title: Warning from Allah to select good friends | Sheikh Assim Al Hakeem -JAL
transcript:
Sheikh Assim: Muhammad from Nigeria.  Muhammad: you can help me what is the meaning of
ٱلْأَخِلَّآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَعْضُهُمْ لِبَعْضٍ   عَدُوٌّ إِلَّا ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
(Surah Az-Zukhruf: Ayah 67)? Sheikh Assim: (corrects   the callers' mistake in the ayah)
ٱلْأَخِلَّآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَعْضُهُمْ   لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ إِلَّا ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
Muhammad: Na'am (yes) This Ayah is a clear warning 
from Allaah azza wa jall to us mortals, who live on earth,   that we have to select our friends, 
and this topic by itself, it should   be devoted into like two or three lectures, 
because it's so hugely important in our lives, yet nobody pays any importance to 
it. Nobody pays any attention to it.   So Allah says in the Qur'an (translation 
of the meaning): {Best friends   on the day of judgment will be foe (an 
enemy) to one another,} Whoa! Why is that? {Except the righteous,} So if I have 
friends in this life, he's my best buddy.   Is he righteous? Nope. Then why is he my best 
friend? Oh man! This guy cracks jokes like crazy,   and it's all from the belt down. It's so 
graphic, it's so obscene, it's so filthy!  He makes me laugh like crazy! Aah on the day of 
judgment he'll be your enemy. Why is this man your   friend? Because he knows a lot of people (influential), he has power and authority. So he,   if not breaks rules for me, he bends them and I 
can get away with many many things Okay, he'll   be your enemy on the day of judgement. What about 
this guy? Oh this guy! He is so filthy rich.   He deals with Riba, deals with extortion, deals 
with bribes, and I get a lot of money off him, and   I'm happy, and I never tell him this is Halal or 
this is Haram. You and him will be best of enemies   on the day of judgment. So this ayah tells you, if 
you want to take a friend, a close friend, a best   friend, he has to be righteous. Someone if he sees 
you drinking with your left, he says: My friend,   drinking with the left is haram. Drink with your 
right. If I have something in my heart saying:   What the heck?! Is he the moral police?! what 
are you doing?! If I hate what he's telling me,   this means that I am not righteous and 
he has to take another friend. If I say:   (arabic) May Allaah reward you man. I need the 
advice, I need people to come and advise me,   I need people to come and warn me, I need people 
to remind me of Allaah عز و جل and help me to do   good to reach Jannah, those will never 
be enemies on the day of judgment.
